abstract: Federal Communications Commission approves rules that will prevent large business from gaming system and gaining access to discounts available to small-businesses in auction of airwaves on which signals for Wi-Fi and radio are carried in 2016; rules are meant to avoid actions like those of Dish Network in 2014, which partnered with smaller entities and received $3.25 billion discount on $13 billion purchase.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission rewrote rules on small-business discounts for a coming auction, partly in response to actions by Dish Network.

headline.main: F.C.C. Votes to Limit Discounts in Airwaves Auction
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Limits Discounts in Airwaves Auction to Forestall Abuse

snippet: The Federal Communications Commission rewrote rules on small-business discounts for a coming auction, partly in response to actions by Dish Network.
